Package com.example.vibeverse

Class MoodAdapter

java.lang.Object
android.widget.BaseAdapter
com.example.vibeverse.MoodAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter
public class MoodAdapter extends android.widget.BaseAdapter
MoodAdapter is a custom adapter for displaying mood entries in a ListView.

Each mood entry is represented as a String. This adapter provides functionality to display the list of moods and also offers callbacks for editing or deleting a mood entry via the MoodAdapter.OnMoodActionListener interface.

    • getView

      public android.view.View getView(int position, android.view.View convertView, android.view.ViewGroup parent)
      Provides a view for an AdapterView (ListView).

      The view is inflated from R.layout.list_item_mood and displays the mood entry. It includes a delete button; clicking the delete button triggers the MoodAdapter.OnMoodActionListener.onMoodDelete(int) callback, whereas clicking anywhere else in the view triggers the MoodAdapter.OnMoodActionListener.onMoodEdit(int) callback.

      Parameters:
      position - The position of the mood entry within the adapter's data set.
      convertView - The old view to reuse, if possible.
      parent - The parent that this view will eventually be attached to.
      Returns:
      A view corresponding to the mood entry at the specified position.
